title: How to Restart Windows Update if It Does Not Make Download Progress in Windows 10

steps.title: Restart Windows 10
steps.content: Restart Windows 10 . Click the Start button, then click Power , after, click Restart .

steps.title: Open Windows Services
steps.content: Open Windows Services . Click the Start button, type services.msc , then press ↵ Enter after it finishes searching.

steps.title: Stop the Background Intelligent Transfer Service service.
steps.content: Stop the Background Intelligent Transfer Service service. Find Background Intelligent Transfer Service , right click it, then click Stop .

steps.title: Stop the Windows Update service.
steps.content: Stop the Windows Update service. Find Windows Update , right click it, then click Stop .

steps.title: Open the Run dialog.
steps.content: Open the Run dialog. Press ⊞ Win + R .

steps.title: Delete everything
steps.content: Delete everything in the folder that opens. Press Ctrl + A to select all of the files in the folder, then press ⇧ Shift + Delete and click Yes to permanently delete the files.

steps.title: Restart services previously stopped.
steps.content: Restart services previously stopped. In the Services.msc window, right click Background Intelligent Transfer Service and click Start , then right click Windows Update and click Start .

steps.title: Download the updates again.
steps.content: Download the updates again. Open Windows Update then check for updates.
